content: Laws of Grain and Drink Offerings
And the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you have come into the land you are to inhabit, which I am giving to you,

and you make an offering by fire to the , a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering or in your appointed feasts, to make a sweet aroma to the , from the herd or the flock,
then he who presents his offering to the  shall bring a grain offering of one-tenth  of fine flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of oil;
and one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering you shall prepare with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, for each lamb.
Or for a ram you shall prepare as a grain offering two-tenths  of fine flour mixed with one-third of a hin of oil;
and as a drink offering you shall offer one-third of a hin of wine as a sweet aroma to the .
And when you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering, or as a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a peace offering to the ,
then shall be offered with the young bull a grain offering of three-tenths  of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil;
and you shall bring as the drink offering half a hin of wine as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the .
‘Thus it shall be done for each young bull, for each ram, or for each lamb or young goat.
According to the number that you prepare, so you shall do with everyone according to their number.
All who are native-born shall do these things in this manner, in presenting an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the .
And if a stranger dwells with you, or whoever  among you throughout your generations, and would present an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the , just as you do, so shall he do.
One ordinance  for you of the assembly and for the stranger who dwells  an ordinance forever throughout your generations; as you are, so shall the stranger be before the .
One law and one custom shall be for you and for the stranger who dwells with you.’ ”
Again the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land to which I bring you,
then it will be, when you eat of the bread of the land, that you shall offer up a heave offering to the .
You shall offer up a cake of the first of your ground meal  a heave offering; as a heave offering of the threshing floor, so shall you offer it up.
Of the first of your ground meal you shall give to the  a heave offering throughout your generations.
Laws Concerning Unintentional Sin
‘If you sin unintentionally, and do not observe all these commandments which the  has spoken to Moses—
all that the  has commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day the  gave commandment and onward throughout your generations—

then it will be, if it is unintentionally committed, without the knowledge of the congregation, that the whole congregation shall offer one young bull as a burnt offering, as a sweet aroma to the , with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one kid of the goats as a sin offering.

So the priest shall make atonement for the whole congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them, for it was unintentional; they shall bring their offering, an offering made by fire to the , and their sin offering before the , for their unintended sin.
It shall be forgiven the whole congregation of the children of Israel and the stranger who dwells among them, because all the people  unintentionally.
‘And if a person sins unintentionally, then he shall bring a female goat in its first year as a sin offering.
So the priest shall make atonement for the person who sins unintentionally, when he sins unintentionally before the , to make atonement for him; and it shall be forgiven him.
You shall have one law for him who sins unintentionally,  him who is native-born among the children of Israel and for the stranger who dwells among them.
Law Concerning Presumptuous Sin
‘But the person who does  presumptuously,  native-born or a stranger, that one brings reproach on the , and he shall be cut off from among his people.
Because he has despised the word of the , and has broken His commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his guilt  upon him.’ ”
Penalty for Violating the Sabbath(AD)
Now while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.
And those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation.
They put him under guard, because it had not been explained what should be done to him.
Then the  said to Moses, “The man must surely be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.”
So, as the  commanded Moses, all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him with stones, and he died.
Tassels on Garments
Again the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel: Tell them to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and to put a blue thread in the tassels of the corners.

And you shall have the tassel, that you may look upon it and remember all the commandments of the  and do them, and that you  not follow the harlotry to which your own heart and your own eyes are inclined,
and that you may remember and do all My commandments, and be holy for your God.
I  the  your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I  the  your God.”
